com.habelitz.jsobjectizer.jsom.api.statement.base
Interface StatementBlockElementContainer

All Superinterfaces:
JSOM
All Known Subinterfaces:
StatementBlockScope, SwitchStatement, SwitchStatement.SwitchLabel
public interface StatementBlockElementContainer
extends JSOM

Contains and deals with all those JSOM elements that represent statement block elements and that belong to a certain local statement scope.

This class bundles the functionality for all the content a statement block scope can have, i.e. statements and local variable/type declarations, but that may also occur within local scopes that behave like statement block scopes but aren't such scopes from a grammatical point of view (think about the statement scope of case/default labels of a switch statement.

Author:
Dieter Habelitz

Returns a list of local class declarations.

Calling this method equals an getLocalClassDeclarations(null) call.

Returns:
A list of the local class declarations. If there are no local class declarations null will be returned.

getLocalClassDeclarations

java.util.List<LocalClassDeclaration> getLocalClassDeclarations(java.util.List<LocalClassDeclaration> pList)
Returns a list of local class declarations.

Parameters:
pList - If this argument isn't null the class declarations will be added to this list and this list object will be returned. Otherwise a new list will be created for the result.
Returns:
A list of the local class declarations. If there are no local class declarations null will be returned, even if the argument pList isn't null.

getSelectedStatementBlockElements

java.util.List<StatementBlockElement> getSelectedStatementBlockElements(StatementBlockElement.ElementType[] pStatementBlockElementTypes,
                                                                        java.util.List<StatementBlockElement> pList)
Returns selected statement block elements.

Parameters:
pStatementBlockElementTypes - An array of StatementBlockElement.ElementType.??? constants. If this argument is null implementations are expected to return null. Furthermore null for array elements must be ignored.
pList - If this argument isn't null the statement block elements will be added to this list and this list object will be returned. Otherwise a new list will be created for the result.
Returns:
A list of selected statement block elements. If no statement block element matches the given statement block element types null will be returned, even if the argument pList isn't null.

getStatementBlockElements

java.util.List<StatementBlockElement> getStatementBlockElements()
Returns a list of the statement block elements.

Statement block elements can be variable declarations, type declarations and all kind of statements.

Calling this method equals an getStatementBlockElements(null) call.

Returns:
A list of the statement block elements. If the statement block contains no elements (not even an empty statement) null will be returned, even if the argument pList isn't null.
See Also:
getStatementBlockElements(List)

getStatementBlockElements

java.util.List<StatementBlockElement> getStatementBlockElements(java.util.List<StatementBlockElement> pList)
Returns a list of the statement block elements.

Statement block elements can be variable declarations, type declarations and all kind of statements.

Parameters:
pList - If this argument isn't null the statement block elements will be added to this list and this list object will be returned. Otherwise a new list will be created for the result.
Returns:
A list of the statement block elements. If the statement block contains no elements (not even an empty statement) null will be returned, even if the argument pList isn't null.

getStatements

java.util.List<Statement> getStatements()
Returns a list of all statements.

This method returns a list of all the statements that belong to the statement block scope represented by this. I.e. the returned list will contain all the content of this excepting local variable and type declarations.

Of course, the list will contain the statements in the same order they have been stated within the Java source code and the first list entry corresponds to the first statement within the statement block scope.

Calling this method equals an getStatements(null) call.

Returns:
A list of all statements or null if the this has no statement.
See Also:
getStatements(List)

getStatements

java.util.List<Statement> getStatements(java.util.List<Statement> pList)
Returns a list of all statements.

This method returns a list of all the statements that belong to the statement block scope represented by this. I.e. the returned list will contain all the content of this excepting local variable and type declarations.

Of course, the list will contain the statements in the same order they have been stated within the Java source code and the first list entry corresponds to the first statement within the statement block scope.

Parameters:
pList - If this argument isn't null the statements will be added to this list and this list object will be returned. Otherwise a new list will be created for the result.
Returns:
A list of all statements. If the statement block contains no statements (not even an empty statement) null will be returned, even if the argument pList isn't null.

hasStatementBlockElement

boolean hasStatementBlockElement()
Tells if the statement block scope has at least one statement block element.

Returns:
true if the statement block scope has at least one statement block element.

hasStatementBlockElement

boolean hasStatementBlockElement(StatementBlockElement pStatementBlockElement)
Tells if a stated statement block element belongs to this.

Parameters:
pStatementBlockElement - The statement block element that should be searched within this.
Returns:
true if the stated statement block element belongs to this.

removeStatementBlockElement

void removeStatementBlockElement(StatementBlockElement pStatementBlockElement)
                                 throws JSourceObjectizerException
Removes a certain statement block element from this.

Calling this method equals an removeStatementBlockElement(StatementBlockElement, true) call.

Parameters:
pStatementBlockElement - The statement block element that should be removed. The argument passed to this method remains unchanged.
Throws:
JSourceObjectizerException - if the statement block element passed to this method doesn't belong to this.

removeStatementBlockElement

void removeStatementBlockElement(StatementBlockElement pStatementBlockElement,
                                 boolean pRemovingOfSurroundingHiddenTokensEnabled)
                                 throws JSourceObjectizerException
Removes a certain statement block element from this.

Parameters:
pStatementBlockElement - The statement block element that should be removed. The argument passed to this method remains unchanged.
pRemovingOfSurroundingHiddenTokensEnabled - If true the method also tries to remove surrounding whitespaces and comments that most likely belongs to the statement block element.
Throws:
JSourceObjectizerException - if the statement block element passed to this method doesn't belong to this.

replaceStatementBlockElement

void replaceStatementBlockElement(StatementBlockElement pOldElement,
                                  java.lang.String pNewElement)
                                  throws JSourceObjectizerException
Replaces a certain statement block element by a new one stated as string.

Parameters:
pOldElement - The parameter declaration that should be replaced.
pNewElement - The new parameter declaration.
Throws:
JSourceObjectizerException - if the stated old statement block element doesn't exist or if unmarshalling the new statement block element failed.
